Neuronal acetylcholine receptor subunit.Definition: A protein that is a translation product of the CHRNA10 gene or a 1:1 ortholog thereof. This nAchR subunit is required for the normal function of the olivocochlear system which is part of the auditory system. Furthermore selective block of α9α10 nicotinic acetylcholine receptors by the conotoxin RgIA has been shown to be analgesic in an animal model of nerve injury pain. (Adapted from PRotein Ontology and Wikipedia).
